Description: FRagment of oval handle from neck join to sharp turn of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay near fine red-brown. Circular stamp with Helios head symbol.
Curator's comments: Name Damokrates. The stamp is akin to one in the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria (ABC 0116.46), which is assigned to the eponym Damokrates II. The legend there is in the nominative, not genitive.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (129)
